title: Cameron intervenes to halt Briton's Saudi sentence of 350 lashes
text:
DAVID Cameron is to intervene personally in the case of a 74-year-old British cancer survivor sentenced to 350 lashes in Saudi Arabia. 
Karl Andree was jailed for 12 months after being caught with illegal alcohol. 
His family said he might not survive the physical punishment that would follow his custodial term and have asked the UK Government to call for a halt to it. 
Loading article content 
Mr Andree's younger son Simon said: "Until his arrest, he has always been happy working there and felt safe. He is 74 years of age, has had cancer three times and his wife is dying in a home in the UK.” 
He added: "He now needs medical care for his cancer and asthma and there is no doubt in our mind that 350 lashes will kill him." 
No 10, asked about Mr Andree’s plight, revealed the Prime Minister would now be writing to the Saudi government about the "extremely concerning" case. 
Mr Andree, a grandfather of seven, has lived in the Middle East for the last 25 years, having worked in the oil industry. 
He was arrested in Jeddah in August last year after bottles of home-made hooch were discovered by police. Share article 
A Foreign Office spokesman said: "Our embassy staff are continuing to assist Mr Andree, including regular visits to check on his welfare, and frequent contact with his lawyer and family. 
"Ministers and senior officials have raised Mr Andree's case with the Saudi government and we are actively seeking his release as soon as possible," he added. Promoted Stories
